number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 15, 2015
Early Access Review
								Ok things are good! I had a lot of trouble enjoying DDII at first but many of my issues where shared by the community in general and were listened to! Now we have a good game. It's not flawless but for free you can check out DDII yourself and see how it works.   My only challenge was the lack of customizability and how microtransactiony DDII was. Now you can get the premium currency in game (albeit slower that just buying it but that makes sense.) and there's many ways in game to unlock customizable parts for your heroes.    Considerable Flaws? To me the gameplay feels a bit less smooth. Not in a framerate way but just trap radius seem smaller, traps seem to do less damage comparitively to DDI but this IS a sequel so hey, also character damage seems more limiting even with a hero damage build, but the game is still beatable etc. Inventory feels a bit limiting but also is a microtransaction away from having more inventory. Character slots are the same, you can have 4 characters in your roster but if you want more you have to pony up or delete a current character. I didn't find any of these to ruin my entire experience though.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: April 23
Early Access Review
								You know, I used to enjoy this game.  To be honest, it used to be my favorite game, until chaos came out.  I came back after a few months of not playing, due to more recent games like overwatch.  I came back to see that all of my spheres, which made it super fun to play, were deleted.  iPwr, which I spent about 200 hours farming, just to be able to finish Nightmare IV, which is now gone, has been deleted as well.  All of my kits I had spent so long building, and all of the friends I had spent so long gaining, are now gone.  Even my friends are reccomending me to quit, which I might as well do until the previous game I used to love comes back.  My kits for Nightmare IV are still there, just not as effective due to the removal of spheres.  My shields for the squire went from having approximately 500K to 55K.  My Poison Dart Towers went from about 15K dps to 1k dps.  I instantly was furious.  I had spent so much time, just to watch all of my hard work crumble right before me.  I shall not be returning to this game, until I see on the youtube channel that there was an update allowing spheres again.  Thank you to those who read this extensive review, but to be honest, I would not reccomend this game anymore.  Maybe previously, but not now.

content:
Posted: July 24, 2016
Early Access Review
								I normally stay away from doing reviews, but honestly the community who want to dog this game is absurd. The game is still in Early Access. Now sure we are going on almost 2 years (in a few months), but there are plenty of other games that have done the same. People complain about Microtransactions, people complain that they can't just buy the game, people complain that and this and bah. Skins can cost however much they want, you don't have to buy them. The heros don't have to be bought. Sure it takes awhile to earn them I have put 150 hours into the game most of which was before they even had defender medals. So, I have just now earned One of the Heroes and I barely put time into it People are complaining that they are putting out new content. I have never in all my years heard of people complain because they are getting new stuff. "It costs too much" Then don't buy it "It takes to long to get" Then don't get it. This isn't a Moba where they are going to release 60+ Heroes. They are not going to just give away what they are spending their time making without making you earn it. They are even nice enough to make it so the costs goes down after a week of the new Hero coming out. Which they have no real reason to do. (Though I admit that it costing the exact cap is kinda annoying as it means you have to stop if you get there and the hero hasn't came out yet but I digress)

								It's a really free-to-play game, I love it. But there's an issue that I can't find any solution and many other people have this problem too. No matter what computer you have (even a high-end pc) it'll most likely crash. Since this is a co-op game, at some point you'll either help or ask for help but with this issue it's almost impossible. The only "solution" right now is adding each other through steam, so whenever one of the members crash they'll have the possibilty of joining again.EDIT:Looks like the issue is fixed, however I stopped playing this game due to the balance changes that came a couple of months ago. Without having much heroes they decided to nerf one of the most important hero that was necessary in a really high difficulty level, if I'm not wrong its towers dps were decreased for around 30-40% (can't remember what were the exact nerfs) making it extremely hard to complete one of these missions (well, with every update they'll always be an adaption so players found other ways to get over it, including spending more money on the game or having better gear). Yet, I find this game incredibly good.

								I loved the first dungeon defenders so much. Just total stupidety of the weapons and pets you could have. Using and archer with a many gun while your Team Fortress Pyro is shooting flames around you, Hell yeah.I was really looking forward to this game, expecting the same experience as DD 1, but hell i have been disappointed. First of al the pre-order, i dont mind supporting the Devs for this game, but the fact that it is free to play now is kind of questionabel for me. But the most dissapointing thing of all is the lack of 'fun'. I could play DD1 all day every day, feeling like it was a new game everytime i played with endless possibilities. The pets were really interesting and the weapons were ridicilous but that made it so fun to play. So ofcourse i buy the new DD2, but where is the fun? Every level feels like the lever before that, i just doesn't have the fun factor as DD1. And it has been in pre alpha for hella long. The updates don't feel right, just more stuff you can get for real $$ or â¬â¬. It sucks, it is cruisin towards a game where, if you want to beat all the levels, you just have to pump your hard earned money in it.  Beside this fact all those new chars/heroes coming out. I pre ordered it for a lot of money, and know you are saying i dont get the new chars unless i pay another 20 dollars? Or i have to play for a loooot of hours. Me no likie. For a F2P game this game can/is really fun. But for the Dungeon Defenders fan, we better get back playing DD1, where the fun was real.

number of helpful: 7 of 14 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 13, 2015
Early Access Review
								After seeing this game come out a few days after 2014 christmas, I decided to take some of my money and bought the pre-alpha.When the game first came out, I was near addicted. Not fully addicted as I had other games to play - Mainly dota - but those games I already spent money in so I feel inclined to show some love here and there. Mostly however I was playing Dungeon Defenders II. I was so addicted I bought another copy of the pre-alpha for a friend, who plays it with me occasionally and generally we both enjoy it.I'll be brief with the positive and the negatives, but for those of you who are lazy about reading; Buy this game.1: The game has flucuating loot. No two weapons will be the same, legendaries actually feel... legendary... and generally speaking the game presents tons of options for you to mess around with. Want to go DPS squire? Sure, go for it! Want to go poison dart tower huntress? Go for it! The game gives you freedom of choice in this scenario.2: The developers are actively interested in making their game the best, consistently adding a weekly report on what they accomplished each week. They also have a great sense of humor with patch notes. (Still can't forget "Squire can no longer father children. Yes, I know, it's a sad day")3: The game feels fun while reminding you that it is a bit grindy. Yes, you have to grind for your loot at higher levels, but for at least the duration of the campaign it keeps introducing new mechanics that keeps you on your toes. Incursion and Infinite-reward waves are also interesting concepts, but hard.4: The game is becoming F2P today! In a recent patch, they will be performing an open alpha - a very rare sight! Even you, that random viewer whos viewing this because it came up on your steam overlay, could play this game, right now! And don't be concerned about "P2W" - Trendy has made sure that the game is only "Pay to look cool". And for those people who pre-purchased, they get 2000 gems free - enough for some snazzy gear.5: The graphics are beautiful and snazzy, and really colourful. They even have reskins of different levels depending on what mode you are playing. (For instance, normal throne room is all bright and cheerful, while nightmare throne room is gloomy with thunder and lightning.) The anbient effects are really nice most of the time, and the animations are fluid.There's tons more I want to say, but I'd rather just say experience it yourself today, when the patch goes live! Only warning; the game is known to hog a little memory. But my PC is semi-spec, and can still run it with virtually no lag.HF!

number of helpful: 4 of 8 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 1
Early Access Review
								They did it!  They made lightning strike twice.  I am so GLAD I stopped playing this game early on.A little bit of story.  I played the HELL out of DD1 200+ hours.  Had some of the very best gear, and an awesome female mage.  I was unstoppable.  Then they decided to stop all development, make this new game, and drop any support or conversion from DD1.  I was rather upset over this.  But hey I decided maybe the new game would be better.It wasn't..  I played 1-2 hours after every major update.  At first it was broken, then it was passable... but now?   They did it again and screwed up their game royally.  They screwed over their players by nerfing all the weapons, making drops more rare, and completely changing the skill system around.  They want to nickle and dime you instead of giving you a good experience.  I can say with a smile, that I am happy I never gave this the time of day until later.  I figure I'd let them flesh it out a bit.  turns out that meant for them to take a knife to it and start aimlessly digging around.So in short, screw this game.  In long, Where is the damn gender change for characters?  I wanted my female mage back, but nope, can be bothered adding a simple couple of skins to add variety.  Good bye DD2, I'm sad it had to end like this, but you done screwed it up.

content:

Early Access Review
								    I have played this line of games since Trendy first started the dungeon defenders series and will continue to as long as they make them. It is a very interesting game to me because i like the challenge and the grind factor that seems to be endless. I like the progression level of the game as well wiht the exception of the massive increase between nm3 and nm4. Now that said there a few things that need to be addressed with the game like the supposed fixes that cause more problems than they fix and the push to rush new content that is incomplete or broken. i am sure that most would rather have quality over quantity. This problems seems to derive from the fact they want to sell something new to you to keep the money rolling which is understandable but its not worth it to pay for something that doesnt work since they keep coming up with new things to sell you without fixing what they have already sold. It is a great game and i hope that they keep producing but would like to see more solid fixes and updates as well as better balancing.

content:
Posted: February 14, 2016
Early Access Review
								I do find this a very enjoyable game but i'm not one to grind for nm4 gear, rather i farm more of the events and monthlies which are the only real fun thing at this time about this game.There has been talk of adding some of the DD1 events/options in and i hope they do; more variety of play will help players and this game over all.  Okay Here goes;They continue to polish this game and to read player feedback(Unfortunetly they don't always listen to said feedback but i'm optimistic they will eventually)The graphics and character changes are nice (but the bugs and coding issues cause me to play this way lower so most of their efforts are blurrs and i just bypass it)I love all the pet changes that have been made(lots of nice pets but no options to aquire more space unless you pay real money.)No banks at all is definetly a big con here; you have to carry everything on your character with no storage options just buy bags with real money and that has a cap.  Also only one inventory for all characters.Their personal interface is buggy and doesn't run well with Steam at times; definetly needs work.I am one of the first to mention their prices but with their newest event the Carnival i am pleased to say they finally put in reasonable prices for the carnival tickets (don't get me started on that $48 skin though!!)I will say to new players, the community can be fickle but not inhospitable just be open to learning and listening.  If you come in and yell at builders for not letting you build instead of asking why, you're not going far trust me.Ask questions, read the forums and be patient, people will answer and help you.  Please don't push off their advise just because you don't like it or understand it initally; there are always elitists in every game but not all are!I say try this even with the bug issues, see for yourself if this is a game for you, i feel it has tons of potential and growth if Trendy takes it the right way.  Right now all we can do is wait and hope they do.  I also say try not to be too put off by prices; 99% are cosmetic, the only things that are not are the bags and hero slots.I am recommending this game in hopes it improves and becomes what they tell us it will be.  If it was finished now, i'd say stay clear but its still growing so don't let the Early Access or the F2P turn you away!

number of helpful: 4 of 8 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 15, 2016
Early Access Review
								I really wished I could give this a rating instead of a yes-no recommendation.It would be a 5.5/10 since I can't say that this game is too awesome.My close friends has quit this game in 1 day since early access. Some friends I meet in this game, also quits.My only reason for me to still play this game is the monthly quest, but even then, I play easier levels cause I am bored.Pro:1- Trendy is trying hard, they really want to improve this game.2- They have made several events and I think they will keep doing this to keep the game more fun.3- Monthly quest with (usually) a new nice pet each month.4- Its Dungeon defenders.5- Probably, the most important pro, its not paid to win.Con:1- Repentive and no replayablity. You just play the same map over and over only cause you want better farm which will likely not drop so that you must play more.2- No variety. Each hero has 4 buildings, but you only use a few cause they are clearly better than others. You build every map the same way too, cause if you don't you will have a harder game.3- Fashion dupe galore. Fashion can be earned with a rare currency. 3-5 dupes? Sucks. Got over 17 dupes? Welcome in my world.4- Bad community. Low levels are rude leechers which pisses off high level players. High level players then hate low level player. Got stuck in latemid level? Get hated by high level players who are no longer willing to help you because of toxic community.5- Bad team setup. Just assume that 95% of the players only has dps'er and can only build crap. If you are a decent builder, then they all rely on you. Even if you have 4 character slots, not many will realise it can be a good idea to have 3 builder and 1 dps'er for example.6- Boring gameplay at high level. Build your stuffs? Going to play? Then you have 2 jobs to do. Tank and repair walls or shoot and repair walls.

number of helpful: 7 of 14 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 13, 2015
Early Access Review
								After seeing this game come out a few days after 2014 christmas, I decided to take some of my money and bought the pre-alpha.When the game first came out, I was near addicted. Not fully addicted as I had other games to play - Mainly dota - but those games I already spent money in so I feel inclined to show some love here and there. Mostly however I was playing Dungeon Defenders II. I was so addicted I bought another copy of the pre-alpha for a friend, who plays it with me occasionally and generally we both enjoy it.I'll be brief with the positive and the negatives, but for those of you who are lazy about reading; Buy this game.1: The game has flucuating loot. No two weapons will be the same, legendaries actually feel... legendary... and generally speaking the game presents tons of options for you to mess around with. Want to go DPS squire? Sure, go for it! Want to go poison dart tower huntress? Go for it! The game gives you freedom of choice in this scenario.2: The developers are actively interested in making their game the best, consistently adding a weekly report on what they accomplished each week. They also have a great sense of humor with patch notes. (Still can't forget "Squire can no longer father children. Yes, I know, it's a sad day")3: The game feels fun while reminding you that it is a bit grindy. Yes, you have to grind for your loot at higher levels, but for at least the duration of the campaign it keeps introducing new mechanics that keeps you on your toes. Incursion and Infinite-reward waves are also interesting concepts, but hard.4: The game is becoming F2P today! In a recent patch, they will be performing an open alpha - a very rare sight! Even you, that random viewer whos viewing this because it came up on your steam overlay, could play this game, right now! And don't be concerned about "P2W" - Trendy has made sure that the game is only "Pay to look cool". And for those people who pre-purchased, they get 2000 gems free - enough for some snazzy gear.5: The graphics are beautiful and snazzy, and really colourful. They even have reskins of different levels depending on what mode you are playing. (For instance, normal throne room is all bright and cheerful, while nightmare throne room is gloomy with thunder and lightning.) The anbient effects are really nice most of the time, and the animations are fluid.There's tons more I want to say, but I'd rather just say experience it yourself today, when the patch goes live! Only warning; the game is known to hog a little memory. But my PC is semi-spec, and can still run it with virtually no lag.HF!

number of helpful: 4 of 8 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 1
Early Access Review
								They did it!  They made lightning strike twice.  I am so GLAD I stopped playing this game early on.A little bit of story.  I played the HELL out of DD1 200+ hours.  Had some of the very best gear, and an awesome female mage.  I was unstoppable.  Then they decided to stop all development, make this new game, and drop any support or conversion from DD1.  I was rather upset over this.  But hey I decided maybe the new game would be better.It wasn't..  I played 1-2 hours after every major update.  At first it was broken, then it was passable... but now?   They did it again and screwed up their game royally.  They screwed over their players by nerfing all the weapons, making drops more rare, and completely changing the skill system around.  They want to nickle and dime you instead of giving you a good experience.  I can say with a smile, that I am happy I never gave this the time of day until later.  I figure I'd let them flesh it out a bit.  turns out that meant for them to take a knife to it and start aimlessly digging around.So in short, screw this game.  In long, Where is the damn gender change for characters?  I wanted my female mage back, but nope, can be bothered adding a simple couple of skins to add variety.  Good bye DD2, I'm sad it had to end like this, but you done screwed it up.

content:
Posted: July 25, 2016
Early Access Review
								It's a good, somewhat completed game, that's fun in LAN. :) It's free to play, and there's no real "pay-to-win" need, either. I love how you can collect items throughout, reminding me of Borderlands and Diablo. None of those wussy items like in Secret World and Age of Conan, either. ;) Tons of small gimmicks, like pets and skills. Later in the game you can change some of the effects on the other towers. A few downsides, though: it's buggy (it's alpha, so no surprise there). You'll be thrown out of the game and have to rejoin the match at times (fortunately you don't have to wait for the match to finish before you can rejoin), sometimes the weapon-animations suddenly stop showing, or trying to carry more than 1 gold/crystal during the Kobolt Challenge will simply delete the other, sometimes you just can't connect with a friend and both gotta restart the game... I do wish there'd be a few more towers to chose between for each character, though, but at least you can change character ingame as often  as you wish, and use several types. Yeah, there are downsides. It's a free alpha though, so can't complain and let it prevent me from giving a recommendation, because we (four of us) had a lot of fun. Some even bought the hideously expensive Hero/Costume packs - not worth it in my opinion. My tip? Download it, play it for free, enjoy it a lot (or not, and no money lost). If you like it enough that you'll buy pretty-coloured things for lots of real money, well - all power to you, I suppose. Enjoy!

content:
Posted: February 8, 2016
Early Access Review
								It's DD1 with upgraded visuals. Very enjoyable. For a while.It lacks all the little things, the depth, that makes you want to keep playing the game beyond the first 10-15 hours.In DD1, you could really delve into stats, builds, and have fun with varied maps and challenges. Plus, there was an actual feel of progression. Here, you grind through a lvl 30 map until you get to the level cap (50), simply because it's better than any other gamemode or map when it comes to XP per hour per effort.In truth, if DD2 didn't kill all activity on DD1, I'd still be playing DD1.This game is not an improvement. It's a dumbed down game with better graphics.But the potentional is there.

								Games like these are the ones that you would spend the whole day playing, but since this is only alpha and not the full release, your area and items are limited, but there are alot to choose from. Although, your time on playing the game isn't that fun after you crash. For me I keep crashing for every 6 to 7 hours, then I have to do a process to get back to the game. Right now, when you crash, it might say that your game is still running when you try to retart Dungeon defenders 2. I sort of found a way to get back to your game again, but even if you do the process,the game will still crash. Overall, this game is fun, really fun and especially with your friends, but it can be ruined when your game suddenly crashed and you can't get back on it.  I hope the developers see this and try to fix the problem. For now, I recomend this game if you're willing to play it even though it crashes.

content:
Posted: November 11, 2015
Early Access Review
								First of all, I played about 600 hours in DD1, I dont really think that DD2 can be even REMOTELY as good as DD1 now (even with the fact that 99% of good gear is duped/hacked).Very laggy, crashed after 1 hour of staying in tavern because it ate all my memory (16 gb). Game servers is laggy too, interface is non-convinient. Didnt had any chance to test gameplay in-deep because it eats all my memory and crashes. Also vsync not working. Uninstalled. 0/10 atm.Oh, did I mention that this game is absolutely P2W? I mean F.UÐ¡Ð free to play P2W garbage games, which DD2 is right now. Stash space for money? Additional character slots? Seriously? This is just what I able to see by the time I was wandering around tavern and playing first map for a bit, but I guess since there is some kind of gems currency which you can buy - game is complete p2w garbage. Devs say you can only buy cosmetics with it, at the same time game wants your money for char slots and stash space. Tower balance looks pretty poor at least on squire. In DD1 you could put, as I remember, 3 harpoons on starting map from all chests you got at first level (4+1 chests that give you 40 mana each and harpoon worth 80 I think). Here I just spammed some tower around crystal, I had enough mana to build like 8 towers on first level before first wave. Towers feel less important because of that, you just spam them everywhere because you cant even upgrade them before level 4.Map selection screen looks poorly made with really crappy models and overall worse than DD1's simple and good looking level interface.No option to cancel this really annoying squire attack-step animation.Tab key cant be rebinded (i guess its a console or something). Fix this please.Some weird chests appeared at the end of first mission which took about 10 seconds to appear in unskippable cutscene, then it took me a while to find a little area where I could press E to open middle chest (and why there is two gray chests around it?) and it dropped some loots. Well, easy to fix this, right?I have no idea why it gets so many positive rewiers, I guess people see that its free to play and happy about it, it also brings a lot of new people to the game. Thrust me, DD1 is amazing atmospheric game, nothing in tower defence genre will ever be even remotely close as good as it is. Endgame has its problems, hacking is a big problem, but still.I just dream of DD1 reset with new VAC system and some kind of auction house, couple of new maps and achievements, option to make graphics not so anime-like - bam, perfect all-time TD game.

content:
Posted: October 18, 2015
Early Access Review
								This is easily one of the most polished Early Access titles.It has hundreds of hours of gameplay and it's not even close to finished.The developers are constant responding to feedback and adjusting their game to make it better on close to a monthly basis.They have a great team that works with their community and they try to assist their Twitch community as well.Pros:Easy to learn/hard to master gameplay that's a mix of Tower Defense, twitchy-action, and role-playing.Wyvern bosses to slay.  Four characters that have build variety to make them unique.PetsCostumesGREAT 4-player Co-opDecent leveling (could be better, but it's alpha!)Perks for having multiple characters (builds, increased XP, etc.)Weekly Devstream talking about what they're working onLots of loot farmingCons:Maybe a little more work on the pricing of some itemsBetter leveling between 40-50 (50 is max level)Needs more build variety in end-game(it's coming soon, but had to list as a con)UI needs work, along with inventory improvementsOverall, this game is phenomenal for being F2P and in Early Access.There's still some bugs here and there, but the developers are responsive to their community and are constantly updating/hotfixing and making changes.

content:
Posted: October 11, 2015
Early Access Review
								When I first got this game, I had high expectations for it. Dungeon Defenders 1 was spectacular and the 2nd needed to live up to its legacy. After some time of good updates, this game has become a very good game, to the point where i might say it is better than the 1st. The pet system is amazing, the improved animations are good, and the newly introduced towers are spectacular. One negative to Dungeon Defenders 2 is that it doesnt have as much variety as the 1st (DLC Characters and Levels). These will probaly be made later after Early Access. If you are going to get this game, I would tell you to wait till it goes free in December, however, if you want bonus in-game credits, buy it early access.

content:

Early Access Review
								    I have played this line of games since Trendy first started the dungeon defenders series and will continue to as long as they make them. It is a very interesting game to me because i like the challenge and the grind factor that seems to be endless. I like the progression level of the game as well wiht the exception of the massive increase between nm3 and nm4. Now that said there a few things that need to be addressed with the game like the supposed fixes that cause more problems than they fix and the push to rush new content that is incomplete or broken. i am sure that most would rather have quality over quantity. This problems seems to derive from the fact they want to sell something new to you to keep the money rolling which is understandable but its not worth it to pay for something that doesnt work since they keep coming up with new things to sell you without fixing what they have already sold. It is a great game and i hope that they keep producing but would like to see more solid fixes and updates as well as better balancing.

number of helpful: 2 of 4 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 4, 2016
Early Access Review
								Graphics:- Nice comic-style with a lot of bright colors, resulting in a very "warm/lovely" atmosphere- A lot of variation in maps for example old dungeons, green fields, gigantic sewers, burning cities, spooky forests or a throne room and there is much more! New maps are constantly added, each with their own layout and theming.- The characters are designed with a lot of love for details and they all look very different from each other. You can also buy skins with ingame currency to give you a bit more variation.-> Overall one of the biggest pros for me are the graphics. I could stare hours into the beautiful landscapes and also write hours about it ;)Balance/Bugs/Ingame Currency-> Trendy constantly adds new content to the game, so they can have all features they want as quickly as possible, but this also results in a lot of bugs. The worst bugs get fixed quickly. The balance issues are not that bad in early stages of the game, but in the endgame there are only a few viable towers/characters. IÂ´m sure the balance will get fixed, since most of the old characters will get reworked soon to be as good as the new ones. The ingame currency is fine. You can get some skins and additional inventory slots with it, but nothing that would give you an advantage in the game.Gameplay:- A lot of variation in maps, difficulties, items and characters. You can even equip spheres to boost your character to the max. or take a pet to help you in battle- Tons of enemies, each with their own strengths and some with special abilitiess- The normal gamemode is nice and balanced and will take you a good amount of time to reach the last difficulties.- The second gamemode is named "onslaught" and is basically an endless mode. The gamemode is fun but does not provide good rewards at the end. IÂ´m sure they will make some work on this gamemode soon.- The third and last gamemode is named "incursion" and is a much harder version of the map you choose. The gamemode is very challenging and is okey so far. But they currently work on adding a different task for each map and a unique reward if you win. There is already one map with this concept and iÂ´m very happy with it.- Daily missions/monthly missions have good rewards and are well done.- Characters all have their own playstyle and look.I could write on for hours, because there is so much more to talk about, but i wanted to keep it short and just give you an idea of the current state of the game!  Result:-> The fantastic graphics, love to details and the variety of characters, pets, enemies and maps, make this one of my favorite games. I spent over 440 hours on this game so far and donÂ´t regret anything. The Trendy team is friendly and listens to the community. Constant patches with new characters, challenges, maps and much more keep the game interesting and fun. Just keep in mind that the game is in development and still contains some bugs and balance issues, but overall I can totally recommend you to test it out yourself, you wonÂ´t regret it!!

content:
Posted: July 7, 2016
Early Access Review
								Loved Dungeon Defenders I.  Dungeon Defenders II is a steaming pile of poop.  It isn't ready for release to the public at all and I'm very, very unhappy that they charged a fee for a game in this state.  I originally bought the game months ago (it's 7/7/16 now), and as of yesterday the game is still garbage.  I feel insulted and I feel like I was taken advantage of.  I spent more than a decade making games professionally, and what I see in this "released" game is horrible.The biggest problem with the first game appears to be that the art direction (which I think is lovely) attracts an incredibly young player base who isn't particularly suited to strategy gameplay.  The sequel seems to be lining up to be the same mess of incredibly young player population who play selfishly rather than cooperatively even at the cost of losing the match, and prefer to have their characters speed leveled by high level games rather than earning their levels and actually learning how to play the character classes and the maps.I wouldnât consider recommending this game to anyone for any reason in its current state.  After the game is actually in a completed state I would recommend it as I would the original game, if you have a player group already assembled who can play together, go for it.  But, as an adult  it isnât worth the time to deal with the immature player population.

content:
Posted: April 23
Early Access Review
								You know, I used to enjoy this game.  To be honest, it used to be my favorite game, until chaos came out.  I came back after a few months of not playing, due to more recent games like overwatch.  I came back to see that all of my spheres, which made it super fun to play, were deleted.  iPwr, which I spent about 200 hours farming, just to be able to finish Nightmare IV, which is now gone, has been deleted as well.  All of my kits I had spent so long building, and all of the friends I had spent so long gaining, are now gone.  Even my friends are reccomending me to quit, which I might as well do until the previous game I used to love comes back.  My kits for Nightmare IV are still there, just not as effective due to the removal of spheres.  My shields for the squire went from having approximately 500K to 55K.  My Poison Dart Towers went from about 15K dps to 1k dps.  I instantly was furious.  I had spent so much time, just to watch all of my hard work crumble right before me.  I shall not be returning to this game, until I see on the youtube channel that there was an update allowing spheres again.  Thank you to those who read this extensive review, but to be honest, I would not reccomend this game anymore.  Maybe previously, but not now.

content:
Posted: December 9, 2014
Early Access Review
								First 2hrs, already impressed. In my opinnion for its current stage is a big improvement from DD1. Hopefully when its on its final release the anti-cheat will stop the hackers. Since it will be free. So far I rate it 8/10. Great game! Must buy if you got the cash!^ 12/13/2014------ Updated Review.Now for a better review as I have more game time.Straight off we will start yes this game is lacking some very needed functions or should I  say core elements for the game, as trading or even just to drop items in your tavern should be in but I am just going to leave that as it's still in Pre Alpha.As you journey on playing the difficulty "Normal" on some levels if you are new or unexperienced, the levels seem to be some what difficult for someone new to the game. If you are playing alone that is. As again you are meant to play with people, More people more chance of bonus loot(better loot) 4 Players becomes a large chance of good loot.From DD1, I can say that the towers have been nerfed? That don't seem to feel do as much damage as I would rather expect. I was suprised when they had said there wasn't going to be PvP, slightly dissapointed but it isn't that much of a big deal as I got the game to play with friends. Graphics:In my opinnion I think they are a lot better then the previous dungeon defenders and truly like the new graphcs! But again I miss the more cartoony side of the old DD not sure if that makes sense but can't really explain it. - Overall: 7.5/10Maps:Great maps, so far loved all of them! each map is unique and some what different in a way wether your helping crystals or just a cart. Overall: 9/10AI:AI are great, so far there are some great monsters/enemys to verse in DD2, they have annouced there will be more enemys which is great and excited about that! overall: 6.5/10Towers:So far I've played as Monk, Apprentice and Squire. From what my experiences have been the towers lack power as they had more power in DD1. other then that I really like the desings of some towers that are in the current DD2. Overall 5/10Taverns:It can be quite confusing as there is an "Entry Tavern" and a "Private Tavern" (Not sure if there was a public tavern as I played in private groups) And going to the war recruiter is a bit annoying as if you have a player thats 1 level below the war recruiters you can't play, I guess it's to stop boosters? Eh overall: 6/10Inventory:Inventory is really basic at the moment all though, the "Temporary bag"(if your bags full it goes there) just seems to be endless and you can keep getting items not sure if that was intetnional or what. Inventory can be a bit buggy, you can purchase a "Small Bag" for $10,000 In-game Credits and a "Large Bag" for $50,000 In-Game credits. I am not sure if I like this or not, I haven't purchased one as I don't need it. But seems pretty cool. Each item you get can be transferred to other characters ( just stays in your inv) which is handy as same does your money transfers across, I am not sure what happened but a mate and I both got the game at the same time, played same time and he ended up with $40,000 and I had $13,000 but had collected close to same amount of coins laying around. Not sure what happened. Overall 8.5/10Money system:I like how they approched this, insted of Mana being your currecny it's gold. Which is great! Overall: 8/10Overall:Still think with everything I have mentioned it is a fun game, and it is great to participate in the development of this game. Rating:7/10Worth Buying?:Yes and no. It all really depends on yourself. Do you want to support or just wait?If you want to help development then sure go right ahead, but aside that there are a lot of bug's that will be fixed in the near future hopefully but still great game and I do personally think it's worth buying.

content:
Posted: June 30, 2016
Early Access Review
								I wish I could recommend this game, however, I'm becoming tired of supporting these developers. Sure, I got a good 800+ hours of gameplay out of this, but, I feel like I'm just losing hair due to frustration and boredom than enjoyment.Every update introduces some really game breaking bugs, and there are still a few game breaking bugs that have been around for a long while, and Trendy just outright ignores them, even after the community has complained about it. a lot. for a long time. They update their game with near-useless content. We, as a player base, would honestly be happier with THE CORE MECHANICS DONE. THE IMPORTANT SYSTEMS. FOR AN ALPHA STAGE. Why would we need new heroes that don't really introduce new mechanics (that have already been done in dd1), and not actually necessary things from DD1 like a server browser, tavern trading, shopping and personalization, etc. DD2 went backwards, and is now slowly moving forwards, at a snails pace. If anything, the game will be done in another 100 years, when Trendy has gone bankrupt for wasting time on the Alpha stage making pointless add-ons that honestly don't help at the game's current state, or keeps the fanbase dedicated to the franchise.Most of the add-ons introduced seem more like content that should have been added once the game has been complete. Now, I'd like to talk more about the "multiplayer" aspect of this game.Sure, the game is in alpha, but with the devs adding pointless content (only worthwhile update was the UI and hero deck system), they're disregarding what made Dungeon Defenders 1 amazing, when they could be adding the things that really need to be added.There are bugs which Trendy still haven't fixed, and you know it's game breaking when the error literally says "FATAL ERROR".This one bug which crashes your game when you try to join a game with a party, really makes the player want to play solo to avoid all of the frustration of joining games with randoms. This bug has been around for 3 or so updates. Go figure, huh?On to the design side. Who the hell is this game's designer/s? Is there really a roadmap for this game? Who thought it'd be a good idea to focus on end-game heroes, and completely ignore the new players who are trying out the game to see if it's their cup of tea? When ever I go to the social hub, I see new players spamming "LOOKING FOR PARTY" or "CANT FIND PARTY, INVITE ME PLZZ",  which could be fixed by actually adding a bloody server browser. WHICH DUNGEON DEFENDERS 1 HAD.The way this game is going, it'll only last for so long until the userbase will get burned out.Where is the super awesome RNG loot that made DD1 awesome? I want my chainsaw that is 10x the size of my character!In reality, everyone that's maxed out with the same power level will basically have the same stats. Even in text, that really doesn't sound so fun now, does it? Anyway, sorry if I dragged this review for too long,So, please Trendy, make your game great again.

content:
Posted: September 14, 2015
Early Access Review
								"God willing we'll all meet again in Spaceballs 2: The Search for more Money."What do you do when you've milked every possible cent out of your game via DLC, 90% off sales, remakes, and indie bundles?  You make a 'sequel' with less depth to draw in the F2P crowd.There isn't much to say about Dungeon Defenders 2.  It's practically the same game with less towers, smaller maps, fewer bosses, fewer heroes, and an even more tedious grind-to-progress system.  And while the first game could have stood to benefit from more focus this shifts the focus more towards hero action than a tower defense game.  Dropping in a multiplayer game you will rarely be able to build your own fortifications as you start with little mana and the players already there will have taken up the defense limit.  It forces you to recruit friends to play so you can manage some strategy or treat the game as if it were a shallow Diablo-clone focusing on your hero stats.Technically the game is in rough shape.  After nearly a year of Early Access on Steam (and a longer period where it wasn't available for sale) optimization is extremely poor.  Stutters and slowdowns are constant on my 770 with an i5 processor and in two days I've lost count of the number of times I've had to Alt F4 out of a loading screen that hangs forever.Updated: The loading screen issues have been fixed although there is still a degree of stuttering after transitions.To their credit there's no P2W going on.  The stuff you buy with cash is mostly cosmetic and/or speeding up the time you can acquire pets and such.  And, of course, there's daily quests, gold farming, all that 'fun' stuff.  All Trendy has done  here is repackage DD1 and wrapped it up into a nuBlizzard F2P shell.

content:
Posted: January 8, 2016
Early Access Review
								Approx. 65 hours in:I've never really been much for making reviews, but I guess I could say I would gladly recommend this, would even pay 10-20 euro for the game at it's current stage or better.I do like that they decided to make the game F2P, with microtransactions for costumes, that would never affect gameplay (many people are upset, and I don't see why since it only changes your appearance, but fair enough).Many seems to complain about having to buy extra inventory space, and why? I've reached level 50 on all 4 characters, sure I've grinded a little bit, but with the monthly mission, and daily missions, all different characters, lots of different maps, I'd say I haven't grown bored yet from always having variety of a certain kind. Sure, the characters are each amazing for one specific build and suck at the rest, but does it matter? It does come into play with tactics when you reach the end, because the dropped gear is most likely useless if you want defense gear for a tower builder, and you're playing on your hero character, since the "passives" will be made for that particular character you play as. That adds challenge, in my opinion, to using your characters and towers correctly.Also, fun to play with friends, I haven't put money into it, and probably won't put any money into costumes since they, easily unlocked by real money, can still be unlocked with the in-game special currency, that (as far as I know) only comes from Dailies and Monthly missions. I really think people should consider playing the game a little, before complaining about it being all "Microtransactions? This will be a pay-to-win game for sure!"So, all in all, I recommend this game, whether you're a solo player or have friends to play with, though it's always better when you have friends to play with :).P.S. If any developer see's this, I'm curious, when we step out of Alpha, will people keep their characters and items, or will it be reset and we receive stuff based on our playing? Something else maybe?P.S.S. I noticed only 2 bugs in the game so far. 1: Sometimes (SPOILER) Harbinger may stay around even after you finish a "phase" with him, where you can't touch him, he can touch you easily aswell as the ship.2: Sometimes gold & tower mana (greens) can disappear from the ground when I, or a teammate, opens the tower mana chest after a round, and I do not get it picked up, neither gold nor mana, but perhaps there's another explanation to this?

number of helpful: 11 of 22 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 1, 2016
Early Access Review
								Im reading the recent reviews and every review is saying that the new heroes are overpowered and behind a paywall.  After the release of lavamancer im getting too lazy to update this review so just take what you can from this.	 Spoilers	It's notDungeon defenders 2 is a tower defense game where you build towers and defend against an army of orcs. There are multiple maps to play and new maps are being added. The game is grindy and you'll need to farm for gear alot if you want to progress into the higher difficulty, if you're into grinding then this game will be for you.  Let's talk about the classes shall we?	There are 6 classes (7 really soon) monk, squire, apprentice, huntress, abyss lord and EV2.  Monk	 is more of an utility having spells which heals players near him or crowd control enemies, 1 aura which can heal and the other which can buff defenses damage (and health if you have a sphere for it) he has a lightning aura that can damage enemies and can stun them too if they are drenched in water and there's the anti-air tower which should be obvious at what it does. Shoots air targets. Squire	 Is  a tank which can be built as dps thanks to the new weapon, he has a shield to tank hits and has 3 abilities which are, a damaging spell, a taunt and a stun. His defenses are the basic ones he has a cannon tower, barricade, ballista and a training dummy. People should really focus the squire for his barricade because it has alot of health and just saves games for everyone or go dps if you got someone to build walls for you already. Apprentice	 This guy like the squire has similliar defenses. a flameburst tower, barricade, frostbite tower and earthshatter tower. His spells are a tornado, arcane volley which hits enemies that been marked by you, and a mana bomb where the apprentice explodes nearby enemies dealing huge damage. People usually focus him for frostbite towers but he can be built as dps aswell. Huntress	 If you're new to the game, this is going to be your best dps class. almost all her towers are about damage. her ablities are concussive arrow, oil flask which slows enemies and can be used as a combo with her third ability Piercing shot which fires a fire phoenix damaging enemies and making them on fire if they're covered in oil.Her defenses which are, explosive trap, a geyser trap which launches enemies into the air drenching them in water, Blaze ballon and a poison dart tower. Before i talk about the last 3 classes	Now to get the 2 classes you will need to get defender medals which are earned from playing the game, doing daily quests or weekly quests. They are totally free and can be earned in 1-2 weeks. Or you can buy them for gems and support the developers. They cost 10k defenders medals (12k for 2 weeks after release). Now people are saying the game is going the "microtransaction way" is just dumb, because that's not where they are going. You can buy costumes and heroes (which you can still earn for free) that's it. They aren't selling some premium weapons which offer bonus stats and are going to help you in your journey. Now let's continue with the 2 classes Abyss lord	 This guy can be built in 3 ways. Towers, dps or walls ( focusing on your barricade). He has 3 abilities, 1 which buffs any tower of his. His abilities are as follows, abyss stones, knight of the abyss, direct command.His defenses are orc blockade, skeletal ramster, bone archers and the colossus. If you're going to focus on towers then your best bet would be bone archers as they deal the most damage. If you're going dps you're gonna use your 2 first abilities abyss stones and knight of the abyss, you can buy spheres which increase your ability damage at the price of costing more mana to use or the one that increases your attack damage at the cost of increasing the damage you receive. So it's kinda like a double-edged sword. Both are worth obtaining. And the final build of his is the wall build which focuses on his orc blockade. You need to farm gear for his orc blockade which increases it's health by a %. It has more health than the squire walls or apprentices, but it takes more damage from enemies.  EV2	  EV2 has 3 spells just like every other class right now, Anti-gravity bots, death from above and proton charge. EV2 defenses either damage enemies, block projectiles or buff defenses. They are: Proton beam, reflect beam, buff beam and weapon manufacturer. All of them are good and strong. People mostly build proton beam and buff beam because of the insane damage the proton beam can make and buff beam to buff all the other towers damage to huge amounts. Proton beam will be used as your go-to ability to kill bosses which melts them pretty quickly with that ability. Gun Witch	 Gun Witch is a pure dps class, she has no towers only skills which help her kill enemies and do alot of damage oh and she can jump 2 times in the air. She uses a special resource instead of mana which regenerates after a while. Her ablities are as follows: Blunder broom, Scatter sweep, Broom vault, Ice needle. Now the other set of skills is called witchcraft: Book Drop, Two at twice the price where she takes two weapons out and starts shooting like a machine gun and the last skill Broom nado. Overall she's the best dps class right now i'd write more about her but she just recently came out so expect an update some time later about her.Don't listen to the people saying that it's pay to win because it's not. You can get them all for free rather quickly. And to the people who are saying the 2 classes are overpowered and hidden behind a paywall well that's not true. Don't listen to what they say because you can get around 4k-5k defender medals in like a week. This is my first post so forgive me if there's any mistakes in here.

content:
Posted: December 9, 2014
Early Access Review
								First 2hrs, already impressed. In my opinnion for its current stage is a big improvement from DD1. Hopefully when its on its final release the anti-cheat will stop the hackers. Since it will be free. So far I rate it 8/10. Great game! Must buy if you got the cash!^ 12/13/2014------ Updated Review.Now for a better review as I have more game time.Straight off we will start yes this game is lacking some very needed functions or should I  say core elements for the game, as trading or even just to drop items in your tavern should be in but I am just going to leave that as it's still in Pre Alpha.As you journey on playing the difficulty "Normal" on some levels if you are new or unexperienced, the levels seem to be some what difficult for someone new to the game. If you are playing alone that is. As again you are meant to play with people, More people more chance of bonus loot(better loot) 4 Players becomes a large chance of good loot.From DD1, I can say that the towers have been nerfed? That don't seem to feel do as much damage as I would rather expect. I was suprised when they had said there wasn't going to be PvP, slightly dissapointed but it isn't that much of a big deal as I got the game to play with friends. Graphics:In my opinnion I think they are a lot better then the previous dungeon defenders and truly like the new graphcs! But again I miss the more cartoony side of the old DD not sure if that makes sense but can't really explain it. - Overall: 7.5/10Maps:Great maps, so far loved all of them! each map is unique and some what different in a way wether your helping crystals or just a cart. Overall: 9/10AI:AI are great, so far there are some great monsters/enemys to verse in DD2, they have annouced there will be more enemys which is great and excited about that! overall: 6.5/10Towers:So far I've played as Monk, Apprentice and Squire. From what my experiences have been the towers lack power as they had more power in DD1. other then that I really like the desings of some towers that are in the current DD2. Overall 5/10Taverns:It can be quite confusing as there is an "Entry Tavern" and a "Private Tavern" (Not sure if there was a public tavern as I played in private groups) And going to the war recruiter is a bit annoying as if you have a player thats 1 level below the war recruiters you can't play, I guess it's to stop boosters? Eh overall: 6/10Inventory:Inventory is really basic at the moment all though, the "Temporary bag"(if your bags full it goes there) just seems to be endless and you can keep getting items not sure if that was intetnional or what. Inventory can be a bit buggy, you can purchase a "Small Bag" for $10,000 In-game Credits and a "Large Bag" for $50,000 In-Game credits. I am not sure if I like this or not, I haven't purchased one as I don't need it. But seems pretty cool. Each item you get can be transferred to other characters ( just stays in your inv) which is handy as same does your money transfers across, I am not sure what happened but a mate and I both got the game at the same time, played same time and he ended up with $40,000 and I had $13,000 but had collected close to same amount of coins laying around. Not sure what happened. Overall 8.5/10Money system:I like how they approched this, insted of Mana being your currecny it's gold. Which is great! Overall: 8/10Overall:Still think with everything I have mentioned it is a fun game, and it is great to participate in the development of this game. Rating:7/10Worth Buying?:Yes and no. It all really depends on yourself. Do you want to support or just wait?If you want to help development then sure go right ahead, but aside that there are a lot of bug's that will be fixed in the near future hopefully but still great game and I do personally think it's worth buying.

content:
Posted: December 1, 2015
Early Access Review
								tl;drDon't purchase anything because it's listed as a, "Limited Time Offer" or "Exclusive Content"... Because it's not.------------------------------I have always thought that Trendy Entertainment's release of Dungeon Defenders 2, in order to maximize their revenue, has been carried out extremely well. To the point where many would have to bow at their business acumen. I do believe that as time passes, their skills will only become more and more polished.There is absolutely nothing wrong with this. The game itself, for those who like Tower Defense, is certainly very enjoyable to play. Even though it would take some thought and effort, there is absolutely no need to spend a dime on this game.However, for those who do, beware.At any time, supposed, "Time limited" or "Exclusive content" can suddenly become considerably less so.At the time, I never thought to take a screenshot. You would hardly think it be necessary... However I did manage to find a googlecache of a page in another language. Of course, the key part I would like everyone to pay attention to is still in English.http://i.imgur.com/2EJnhkd.jpg"This Collectorâs Pack will only be available on sale until 11/10."I see only two ways to interpret that. 1) The product is currently on special (discounted price) and will only be available at that reduced price until that time.or2) The product will only be available for purchase until that time.As for the former, the price of the packs were not reduced. So it can only be the latter, right?In the days before this date, I ended up purchasing both the Collector's and Defender's Pack, thinking it'd would be best to take advantage of these packs while they were available.To my shock, barely three weeks later, the packs are now on special. If it were only that they were on special, I would just curse my poor luck... but the packs that were supposed to not be on sale any longer are still available for purchase!I don't know what the laws in America are for this, but in my country, this is called False Advertising and is a breach of the Fair Trading Act.I emailed Trendy Entertainment about this and just got a loose response about how they're free put things on special as they wish and to contact Valve/Steam if I have any questions.They seem perfectly unconcerned over this.I can only hope that this warning saves some other poor souls from sufferring the same fate as I.I know that digital content is unable to be refunded, but I will most certainly be asking Steam over what options I have.

content:
Posted: January 13, 2015
Early Access Review
								Pre Alpha Review: To any fan of DD1 I HIghly HIGHLY recommend getting this game. Even as a pre alpha game the gameplay is pretty darn good especially if you include the fact that the UI is more user friendly and also the POV is much much better than DD1. Not only that but the graphics aree really good compared to DD1 whose models and textures were pretty dark and didn't seem that much satisfying to play with. Overall the game is somewhat buggy as sometimes you might experience some usual pre alpha stuff you find in most games. The multiplayer is ok but laggy at some times. I also look forward to having more skills and towers/traps per class and also an offline mode which TBH i only want when i'm bored because soloing the maps are soo much harder than DD1.Okay. I've been playing alot more of DD2 now, and I have to say that the negative reviews this game is getting, it dosen't deserve it. People are complaining how "grindy" this game is, but that's the actual nature of the game. You compare this to DD1 wherein basically people have found ways to hack both the casual and "ranked" mode to get items that give imense amounts of stats, so that's why trendy pushed how DD2 is now. Honestly i'm a fan of grinding in games, and maybe that's a personal preference, but if you're one of those people who complain, and on the side plays monster hunter or some other MMORPG, then if you can do that there, then why not here. Please do not give me the Bullsh** that "Because it's not thesame game" well give it a Fu***ng chance. It may be repetetive, but so is alot of current F2P models out there, like league. If you can stand playing on thesame map, thesame 3 lanes, and somewhat basically the heroes/champs in dota and lol, then why can't you stand playing different maps, using different strategies, using different stat build, etc. I'm just sad that people would give up on the game just because of small reasons. Love or hate it I guess.

								Game ReviewThe game, as directed from the title is a dungeon based defence game in which the player builds towers in order to stop enemy minions from destroying the main base. As well as the main objective on the harder maps, are side objectives which the player needs to defend otherwise it will allow for more enemies, often flying types to be able to access the map making it harder especially without certain classes.Logical thinking is required by the player to complete for ever changes and more difficult maps. As the game calls upon the player to think through the use of their 'Tower Budget' whilst building defences to stop the enemy minions form reaching the main base, the better the tower the higher the cost. Along with the budget, the player has the choice of class types, which impacts the levels massively, as depending on what characters are on the team during the missions effects the difficulty as some cannot attack air units or some are not able to take as many hits as others.Along with the thinking required is the effect of the choices made, as in the game they are able to have a very negative or positive outcome as for example having a Mage try to tank hits from enemies would be a poor choice compared to having a knight tank the hits. But there is a lot more than just deciding what person defends where, each player chooses their class each one having different abilities or attributes that can help the team and as stated above the choice of towers will be one to rule all or end all within an instant.Considering these whilst looking at the game play allows you to see that things are coming together well, the game entices the player into what is called a 'one more round' mood, in which if a player is enjoying the game by winning or by having or rethink the same map several times to pass. As well as being able to invite friends to have a more cooperative team and a more thrilling experience as everyone will be able to have a laugh no matter what the outcome. Overall my experience with Dungeon Defenders 2 was a good experience and produced a lot of good points, however with every game there are a few things that can be tweaked. Such as the enchantment system as I never truly understood it whilst using it and the glitch at the main hub (tavern) where players fall through the floor.Overall i give DD2 a 9/10 rating.

number of helpful: 5 of 10 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 17, 2014
Early Access Review
								For all you who are fans of the origional dungeon defenders or dungeon defenders eternity, this game with be a rollercoaster of nostalgia and wft? For those of you who havent played the previous said games, this will be a fun, quirky, 3rd person shooter, tower defence that can entertain you for hours. If you do not know, DD2 is a tower defence based on the fact that you must defend your base by using towers from 1 of 4 classes. Each class can place down a vastly differnt set of towers from each other, and so it is highly suggested that you play with other people of different classes (so sorry all of you fellow defenders who would play as the squire and solo every map). Other than placing towers, you are supposed to use your third person shooter skills, that you obviously aquired from Star Wars Battle Front 2, to shoot the enemies and help defend your base. Overall, the main point i want to portray is that DD2 is BALANCED. The towers of every class are really good and helpful (yes, the huntress's traps are REALLY good!), and each class has different attacks and abillities to make every class able to dish out decent damage without the use of towers.

The gameplay is thrilling and engaging, which is all I really ask for in a game. Early Access Review
								First of all, I wasn't a great fan of the first game, it was kind of bad and it was too "new generation" for me. (DLC here, DLC that, this - that).But this one is just utterly crap, seriously, I hope that this developer doesn't actually think they're good because it ain't the case, like 98% of today developers, they don't know how to code, it's too complicated to learn something that you'll have to use to for your career, it's the career you choose but nope, everyone does it so it's all right... Right. But anyway, here ain't the problem, it is not the most unoptimized game ever.It's just that, it is crap, the gameplay is utterly crap, it almost feels like the first game but with few new things, you know, the kind of thing that was called "expansion" back in the days?Oh oh, expansions are fine, as long as they are not overpriced and that they actually add content.  Costumes? That should be free, optional, a gift for the players, you don't sell that kind of crap, anyone can use 3D programs and learn, make modding available to us and we'll do it... Oh wait no, of course not, DLCs and microtransactions, right, too incompetent and greedy to put that, right, my bad.Now, for the kiddies that are gonna come and say "but they have to make money you dumb".Right, expansions, new games (I said new games, not crap that looks and play like a expansion and a bad one while at it).Why do people even care about costumes and skins anyway? In a game such as Arma, having some camos for your guns and characters, all right but a skin for a game like this or any game that sells you skins? That is actually pretty dumb and if you think the opposite, you must be dumb as hell, is this where the new generation of gaming is going? If that's the case, I honestly don't want to be a part of it, I'll just stick with the older games that were actually good and that actually had real content.54.99 CAD for the Collector's Edition Upgrade which is let's be honest, pure crap.$100 of in-game currency ($130 of total in-game currency) 4 Exclusive Hero Costumes 4 Tower Skins designed by the Defense Council Exclusive âDragonfall Defenderâ TitleThose guys must be fun... (sarcasm)That's what I call stealing, why having microtransactions in a game like this, a game that you you have to pay 27.99 CAD, yes of course, It's nothing that will makes you stronger, just some outfits and stuff but It's still dumb.Of course we are not forced to buy those but I can't support the fact that I'm stuck with a game where you can buy in-game currency with real money for some stupid costumes that looks like total crap made by some unoriginal teens and for those who looks good, I can't even get them without having to spend real money while I already have spent real money on this game (Dungeon Defenders bundle) which was a big mistake from my part.Also, the game cannot be played offline, It's all on their server which means once they decided to close the server after a while, we won't be able to play this game anymore just for fun which is pretty ridiculous, now, you'll probably say that It is so people won't be able to hack right? Well, people still can hack on a server sided game, It's not that hard when you know what you're doing plus It's just stupid, stop being lazy and make a good anti-cheats system or use VAC with some kind of overwatch, It is not perfect, far away to be, If it detects any kind of modifications or applications that modify stuff, It will gets you a VAC ban so of course It is not perfect but It gets the job done, making the game server sided won't do anything good, people won't want to buy it and you know what they'll do then, I don't need to explain do I?Anyway, not like I'll want to come back on this game since it is pure trash - Just being honest here, facts are facts, if you like this game, that means that you have not played any true games or you are easy to please with anything even if it is crap.It's funny but at the same time It is not, developers think that something is worth that much but for real It is not even worth 9.99$ For example "$100 of in-game currency ($130 of total in-game currency)"No, just stop it, all of that is not even worth 5$ It's just skins and a few gems that you can use to buy skins with, It is NOT worth 100$ neither 50$, stop it with that crap, It's getting real annoying.They said the same with Evolve, that the game is worth 150$ The game is barely worth 29$ Stop it with that damn crap, it's breaking my balls, all that crap is seriously breaking my balls.Come on, a few worthless skins and in game currency is not worthâ¥â¥â¥â¥â¥â¥ stop acting like you guys know everything, you don't know anything about video games neither marketing.Damn developers these days, they're such a nuisance to the video game industry.It takes 7 hours or more to hatch a pet, this is not a simulation or a facebook game, we PC gamers want the best, no phone or console crap.Do you want to know how much it takes time to make a costume? Not very long, two hours at best for a good HD costume.I had lost my characters once, but anyway, it's not like it matters, this game should just be thrown in the trash so the developer/publisher of this game.1.5/10 (I wonder if it even deserves 1.5/10, even not being a fan of Dungeon Defenders, this one is just utterly crap, stay away from it).

content:
Posted: July 31, 2015
Early Access Review
								At the moment I wouldn't recommend this game.  It's pretty good to me but what renders it a little unplayable is how you actually play it.  To play a level, you much join a server, even if you want to do a singleplayer run.  The servers are very laggy at the moment, with 3+ second delays between when I press a key and actually seeing it in game.  I'm constantly "teleporting" due to this server lag and sometimes falling to my death; and the horrible sound I hear when jumping sometimes, just hurts.  I don't like hearing the same sound played multiple times when it should only be played once, but that again is due to server lag.  I would recommend the game if there was an option for local games or a singleplayer mode, just something so that people don't have to deal with BS server lag and bad connections to the current servers.Other than that, I like the game so far, but it's a little difficult for me to make much  progress at the moment.

Early Access Review
								PRO:-RPG + tower defend. -Reople seems nice in general-Very nice graphic-Hotswap to help switching heroes is pretty niceCON:-The game is too easy.-Chat system needs a lot of work-No option blocking other player playerrs or blacklist people-Some people can be very rude. As I mentioned the game is very easy so you don't need great towers to finish a level, but some folks will trash talk your towers as yours not as good as theirs.-Even as a host you can't kick whoever you want.-Forced back to town even if only one of your teammates do not want to keep on playing.-The grinding is pretty lame. -RNG is pretty lame, I always got full bags of lengeary gears, but none got the stats I want. -Some of the outfits are too expensive (Gem store). -You can not trade gears with other players-Often with lag and you always have to wait for getting the team ready and even wait to leave the game when each match end. You can't kick people easy even when you are a host.-You can not sell other player's tower even they are on your way-You you dont need to pay for anything, but be ready to grind many hours to get what you want.

content:
Posted: August 18, 2015
Early Access Review
								I want to like this game I do, but for the reasons I liked DD1, I just can't like the game. I know this game is not DD1, but its just missing the aspect of the game that made me love DD1.Everything is now about item drops. I mean why even have levels anymore? In DD1, from the moment you entered the game with a new character, you assinged your first skill point, that character became yours.  In DD2, originally I had to get level 5, to assing spec points. Now they removed that feature, and replaced it with skill sphere. Oh joy another thing that become completely dependant on item drops. Waiting on item drops is what completely bogged down End Game DD1.  Now its all about finding the best items. I just can't get into this game at all.I do like some of the changes, especially to the Hero skills... but overall, its just lost the very thing that I loved about it. Leveling my own character, and creating my own build.

content:
Posted: December 5, 2014
Early Access Review
								Still a lot of work needs to be done, a lot of things to polish. But I was surprised when I found out that it's only pre-alpha. Gosh, great job. Wonder what awaits us next. On the whole, I'm glad to pay for early access, it's worth buying. Now I just hope that some of my friends will join me...Overall, the game has changed it's every aspect. It has become different, though remained the same. The atmosphere is magical and charming. And gameplay is quite smooth, actually, both in terms of fps rate and the game process itself. And, what really is importmant to me, the interface is quite intuitive, though still leaves much to be desired. For example - I've set a mouse button for some ability, and on the icon of this ability it says: MouseThumbButton1. That's very cute, but it makes me cry, as I don't want to see THIS running over other icons...But, I still strongly recommend this game. I just hope that offline component will be present in a while...

number of helpful: 14 of 29 people (48%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 11, 2014
Early Access Review
								Having over 400 + hours invested in DD1 i was excited to know that DD2 was on early release. rushed to buy for me and my brother who are avid fans, only for our dreams to be crushed by a gutted and completely different game. Towers - Seem to all be made out of the thinest wet toliet paper one can find, along with having the range of kid trying to toss a bowling ball. Secondly most of the ranged enemies int he game out range most of the tower making it near impossible to focus your attention elese where. The constant baby sitting of your towers is kind of counter-tower defense in my opinion. Mobs - Spear chuckers toss spears for 3 miles away out ranging everything and thier spears appear to be armor penetrating as well. Orge's one shot pretty much everything from towers to heroes.Hero's - Armed with weaksauce weapons, and slightly less damp toliet paper armor, they feel weak and borderline uselss against the bigger mobs you have to take on. No hero stats anymore like in DD1 where you could tune your gear to be DPS or Tower spec. Maps - Made by someone who odviously likes playing hack and slash, and has no knowledge of tower defense games and choke points. Almost all the maps have no good defenseable choke points that some spear chucker or dragon cant just range down from afar. Misc - This might just be me, or the game but it is extremely annoying that in order to choose a differnt difficulty range while playing with other people who are lvling up with you, that you have to leave and enter the starter tavern again, just to set the difficulty again. 4/10  - wait for free to play and pray they dont make it Pay to win. Bottom line is, if you loved DD1, dont bother with DD2 unless you like feeling like your at a contant disadvantage.
